name: European Forum for Manufacturing
memberOrga: ABB, AFME, Bosch, Caterpillar, CECE - European Construction Equipment Industry, CECIMO -  European Association of the Machine Tool Industries, CEMA - European Agricultural Machinery, Covestro, Dow, European Domestic Equipment Manufacturers, EEF - The Manufacturers' Organisation, General Electric, Hitachi, Orgalime -  European Engineering Industries Association, Schneider Electric, Siemens, United Technologies, Volvo, ZVEI - German Electrical and Electronic Association
goal: The EFM aims to contribute to the development of  European public  policies addressing the economic, employment, energy and environmental challenges facing technology and manufacturing globally.
interests: Budget, Climate Action, Communication, Competition, Culture, Customs, Development, Economic and Financial Affairs, Education, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Enlargement, Enterprise, Environment, Financial Stability, Financial Services and Capital Markets Union , Food Safety, Information Society, Internal Market, Regional Policy, Research and Technology, Taxation, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport, Youth
euInitiatives: Main EU policies currently followed include the â‚¬315bn Investment Plan; Digitising Industry; Trade and Investment Partnerships; Industry 4.0; Energy Efficiency; Ecodesign; Cybersecurity; FP 9; Compliance; Advanced Manufacturing; Sustainable Finance; Occupational Retirement Provision; Research & Innovation; Remanufacturing and the Circular Economy & Waste.
